result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin N Ramsey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE will contact the COCC office to set up a payment plan for fines.
Defendant eligible for 50% reduction in the cost of installation/maintenance of IID due to indigency.

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Kevin N Ramsey in court with attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg.  Defendant Kevin N Ramsey in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites agreement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC to amended Ct 1, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Ct's 2 and 3 will be DRI.  DE will pay a fine of $2122.00, serve jail time of 230 days, 27 month revocation of DL, 27 month IID, $22.90 restitution, 50% reduction in the cost of the maintenance/installation of IID. Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  DE will set up a payment plan with the COCC office when released from probation hold, jail.  DE may have huber with jail time.  Credit for 30 days served.
